greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A001221(i) = A001221(j) and A006530(i) = A006530(j), for all i, j >= 1.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A001221(n), A006530(n)]. The first member of pair gives the number of distinct prime divisors of n, and the second member gives its largest prime factor.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 11 2020
